title: Map
post:
{{Sidebar("html/reference/elements")}} The **``** [HTML](/blog/Web/HTML) element is used with {{HTMLElement("area")}} elements to define an image map (a clickable link area). {{InteractiveExample("HTML Demo: <map>", "tabbed-standard")}} ```html interactive-example ``` ```css interactive-example img { display: block; margin: 0 auto; width: 260px; height: 232px; } ``` ## Attributes This element includes the [global attributes](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Global_attributes). - `name` - : The `name` attribute gives the map a name so that it can be referenced. The attribute must be present and must have a non-empty value with no space characters. The value of the `name` attribute must not be equal to the value of the `name` attribute of another `` element in the same document. If the [`id`](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Global_attributes/id) attribute is also specified, both attributes must have the same value. ## Examples ### Image map with two areas Click the left-hand parrot for JavaScript, or the right-hand parrot for CSS. #### HTML ```html ``` #### Result {{ EmbedLiveSample('Image map with two areas', '', '250') }} ## Technical summary
Content categories Flow content, phrasing content, palpable content.
Permitted content Any transparent element.
Tag omission None, both the starting and ending tag are mandatory.
Permitted parents Any element that accepts phrasing content.
Implicit ARIA role No corresponding role
Permitted ARIA roles No role permitted
